dyimagefx.morph

Class Erosion

  • java.lang.Object
    • dyimagefx.morph.Erosion

  • public class Erosion
extends java.lang.Object
    File: Erosion.java Description: Implements the image morphology operation: erosion. Erosion operation is basically applied on binary image. The basic effect is to erode away the boundaries of regions of foreground pixels (i.e., WHITE pixels, typically). Binary images are images whose pixels have only two possible intensity values - BLACK and WHITE. WHITE is represented as (255,255,255,255) and BLACK as (255,0,0,0) in ARGB form respectively.

    • Method Detail

      • binaryImage

        public static void binaryImage(MyImage img,
               boolean erodeForegroundPixel)
        This method will perform erosion operation on the binary image img. A binary image has two types of pixels - Black and White. WHITE pixel has the ARGB value (255,255,255,255) BLACK pixel has the ARGB value (255,0,0,0) For erosion we generally consider foreground pixel. So, erodeForegroundPixel = true
        Parameters:
        img - The image on which erosion operation is performed
        erodeForegroundPixel - If set to TRUE will perform erosion on WHITE pixels else on BLACK pixels.

      • grayscaleImage

        public static void grayscaleImage(MyImage img)
        This method will perform erosion operation on the grayscale image img.
        Parameters:
        img - The image on which erosion operation is performed

      • grayscaleImage

        public static void grayscaleImage(MyImage img,
                  int[] mask,
                  int maskSize)
        This method will perform erosion operation on the grayscale image img. It will find the minimum value among the pixels that are under the mask [element value 1] and will set the origin to the minimum value.
        Parameters:
        img - The image on which erosion operation is performed
        mask - the square mask.
        maskSize - the size of the square mask. [i.e., number of rows]
